summary: This is an email chain from September 4, 2019, providing a status update on the investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's co-conspirators. It details recent and upcoming interviews with victims and potential witnesses, including their allegations against Ghislaine Maxwell and other associates, and outlines planned investigative steps by the Southern District of New York.

persons.name: Geoffrey Berman
persons.context: Recipient of the status update email regarding the Epstein co-conspirator investigation.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Central figure in the sex trafficking investigation; his properties and associates are the subject of the inquiry.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Frequently mentioned as recruiting victims for Epstein and being involved in their abuse at multiple locations.

connections.description: Maxwell is described as recruiting victims for Epstein's sexual assaults and being involved in the abuse.
Multiple victims report being recruited by Maxwell for encounters with Epstein that led to sexual assault.

events.title: Interviews with Victims and Associates
events.description: The investigative team met separately with multiple victims (Victim-2, Victim-3, and others) who described being sexually assaulted by Epstein and recruited by Maxwell. They agreed to cooperate.

events.title: Scheduled Attorney Proffer
events.description: Meeting scheduled with defense counsel for an associate (likely a scheduler) for a second attorney proffer regarding her knowledge of the criminal conduct.

events.title: Scheduled Victim Interview
events.description: Interview scheduled with a victim who accuses Ghislaine Maxwell of recruiting her when she was 16.

events.title: Scheduled Reverse Proffer
events.description: Meeting scheduled with an associate (described as Epstein's girlfriend) and her counsel for a reverse proffer. Witnesses report she engaged in sex acts with them at Epstein's direction.

events.title: Scheduled Staff Interview
events.description: Interview scheduled with Epstein's former 'house man' at his New York residence, who has reportedly never been interviewed before.

locations: One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: Multiple victims interviewed on August 27, 2019, described being sexually assaulted by Jeffrey Epstein and recruited by Ghislaine Maxwell.
The investigation was actively scheduling interviews with key figures, including a scheduler who arranged daily massages for Epstein and an associate described as Epstein's girlfriend.
Abuse occurred at multiple Epstein properties globally, including London, Florida, the USVI, and New York, with some incidents dating back to the 1990s.
The document outlines a structured investigative plan involving victim proffers, reverse proffers with associates, and travel to Florida and California for follow-up interviews.
Several victim and witness names are redacted in the document, indicating ongoing sensitivity and protection of identities.
